question: Reaction: <katex>$\text{CH}_3-\text{C}(\text{CH}_3)_2-\text{O}-\text{CH}_3 + \text{HI} \rightarrow A + B$</katex>
A and B respectively are
explanation: Reaction of tert-alkyl ethers with HI follows SN1 mechanism.
The stable tert-butyl carbocation is formed, which reacts with iodide.
Products are tert-Butyl iodide and Methyl alcohol.
